nodes.bodyText: To ensure that out is never null and accomodate for o.e.j.w.j.m.BinaryWholeMessage overriding messageComplete, it's initialized with a sentinel value. It's also possible to override write to ensure that no other messages can write into the sentinel value if this can be a concern (I'm not sure whether extending SimpleBinaryMessage can be considered a public API).

Still seems a little weird to use a static EMPTY_BUF when it is mutable.
I would be more inclined to use null and then in BinaryWholeMessage.messageComplete() do something like
byte[] data = (out == null) ? new byte[0] : out.toByteArray();
This shouldn't be considered public API it is an implementation class.
Hey, @lachlan-roberts! Thanks, the comment addressed in 66f4bda.
